data.text: .I hope #NSEIndia & its MD & CEO Shri Vikram Limaye would respond immediately.  #TOI #DDNewsLive #livemint #dna #ZeeNews #IndiaToday #the_hindu #outlookindia #indiatvnews #mid_day #htTweets #MumbaiMirror #FinancialXpress #DainikBhaskar #NavBharatTimes #timesofindia #AmarUjalaNews https://t.co/CK2OISmel6

.I ask for: 

.Refund retrospectively money earned on member’s deposit of Rs. 500000(Five Lakhs kept for NSCCL Dues for 3Years from the date of cancellation of certificate by SEBI) by #NSEIndia to surrendered members. 

."Let  us remain “connected “
.Does #NSEIndia earn Rs.1,25,000(One Lakhs Twenty Five Thousand) approximately in three Years times on surrendered members Deposit of Rs. 5,00,000(Five Lakhs)?

.Give reasons to retain surrender member Deposits of Rs.1, 00,000(One lakhs) as per the new Circular No.42/2018 dated July 19, 2018? 

.#NSEIndia approved the surrender application only after all the NSCCL dues are cleared. https://t.co/JwBVKNTOlu

.Fixed deposit is a form of cash & can be redeemed in a day’s time, then why the fixed deposit is not asked for NSCCL Dues?

.Does #NSEIndia earn money on members Deposit of 500000 Kept as Cash for NSSCL Dues for 3 Years from the date of cancellation of certificate by SEBI?

.Which year onwards #NSEIndia retains Rs. 500000(Five Lakhs) Deposit of surrendered members for NSCCL Dues? 
.Give reasons for the money is being kept as Cash instead of Fixed Deposit for 3 Years?

.#NSEIndia approves the member surrender application after all NSSCL DUES clears. Give reason for retaining Rs. 5,00,000(five lakhs) deposit of surrendered members earlier & now 1,00,000(One lakhs) for NSSCL dues for 3 Years? https://t.co/ZjqLV25BuC

.Some of the questions to #NSEIndia & its MD & CEO Shri Vikram Limaye: Reply in public space only. 

.My questions to Shri Vikram Limaye are as follows:

.What #NSEIndia understand by the term NSCCL?

.What is the function of NSCCL?

.The #NSEIndia retains Rs. 1,00,000(One Lakhs)deposit of surrendered member for 3 Years for NSCCL Dues from the date of cancellation of certificate by #SEBI. Exchange reduced it recently from Rs. 500000(Five Lakhs) to 1,00,000. The money retained as cash instead of fixed deposit.

.#NSEIndia has not maintained the connection with its members.  Make changes in the rules & regulation of surrender of membership for the best interest of its member & refund the money retrospectively. https://t.co/8yq3ecegtu
